titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Elmer Walter Pehrson Photograph Album A0112
titlestmt.author: University Archives staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

did.physloc: Special Collections and University Archives materials are stored offsite and must be paged three business days in advance. For more information on paging collections, see the department's website: https://library.stanford.edu/libraries/special-collections.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials are open for research use. Audio-visual materials are not available in original format and must be reformatted to a digital use copy.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While University Archives is the owner of the physical and/or digital items, permission to examine collection materials is not an authorization to publish. These materials are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study. Any transmission or reproduction beyond that allowed by fair use requires permission from the owners of rights, heir(s) or assigns.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Elmer Walter Pehrson earned his AB in geology in 1918 at Stanford University and his mining engineer's degree in 1920. He served with the Corps of Engineers, U.S. Army, in 1918. Prior to joining the U.S. Bureau of Mines in 1928, he worked in the west as a mining engineer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The photograph album, kept during his four years at Stanford, includes images of faculty (James Perrin Smith, Cyrus Fisher Tolman, David Starr Jordan, John Casper Branner, Austin Flint Rogers, and Hayes Wilson Young); Geology and Mining Society group portraits; dorm rooms in Encina Hall; several Frosh-Soph Tie-Up events; Roughs Day; bonfires during Big Game; the Assay Lab on campus; 1918 graduation; individual students; and summer hikes (or possibly surveying trips). There are also images of family, Pehrson's military unit, and several from his early jobs. Other items in the album include an original ink sketch by L. Mabel Lawson "Mumm's the Word" (a coed in a champagne class); sketches by Monk Antrim from the CHAPARRAL; and dance cards from Encina At-Homes 1917-18. Other items in the collection include correspondence re jobs, 1920-23; clippings, 1943-50; a photo of Pehrson, 1954; and a copy of THE MOST POPULAR COLLEGE SONGS (1906).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [identification of item] Elmer Walter Pehrson Photograph Album (A0112). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.
